title: Morello, is Malzahar a balanced champion?
body: Please say yes, I don't want the stuffing nerfed out of him :c

Malzahar OP?  Hahahaha!!!

He's got crazy damage and a nasty 1v1 ult, but he is very, very dependent on his team after the laning phase and is incredibly immobile.  With the proper team to peel for him he can be very strong, but try being on a team with little to no peel against a mobility-heavy team.  It can be pretty painful.

I have mixed feelings about Malzahar. Watching someone melt under his full barrage is so fun, and he's actually one of the few champions I have a Quadra kill with (blind Q'd over a jungle wall for the triple, dropped the pool in a bush for the Quad on the fleeing support), but I find him rather... odd unless I get lucky. For one thing I find it nearly impossible to land his Q during laning phase. I have to be able to tell that the enemy is tunnel visioning to get them. The cast animation is so clear, and it gives so much warning, that you can't even really lead it because they'll just stop moving and it'll still miss. Trying to drop his pool and hit them with Visions before your ult usually gives them too much time to get out of range, and more often than not I ult someone when they're JUST out of range of the pool I dropped, or I ult them and accidentally click somewhere or hit an ability in the wrong order and completely waste my ult.

But when you're doing good with him, it just feels so damned amazing. His Visions will cut through almost anyone, his pool cuts through the rest, and you can spend all game making life awful for one member of the enemy team over and over and over. It's like Veigar but with slightly more utility.
See for me I don't find difficulty with landing his Q and using his abilities to the best potential, for some reason he clicks with my play style really well and I find him super fun because of that.

> [{quoted}](name=How Do You Meta,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Iys8sXEp,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-09T08:51:33.242+0000)
>
> It is like Nami's bubble, you usually cast it behind the enemies because they instinctively turn back when they see it :)

See, I do that but it ends up missing anyways. Either they catch onto it and simply stop moving, so it passes in front of them, or they're still able to react quick enough to get out of the way even when I'm leading it behind them. And that's if I'm not limited by the meh range on it; more often than not I'm having to cast it at max range and hope because getting in any closer is a death sentence.

Landing Malzahar's Q, outside of situations where they are actively running away or actively chasing, is totally hit or miss as it relies on your opponent reacting incorrectly.  That said you have to understand that it isn't like other skill shots.  It's actually strongest in team fights where enemies are clumped up.  It also wins 1v1 fights even when you don't have your ult because you can drop it on your opponent do huge damage and cripple them with silence while visions and ignite finish them off.

Also keep in mind that his Q is a great tool to dissuade opponent movement.  I've saved teammates who were being chased with it more times than I can count.  It either lands and takes a ton of their life causing them to rethink their chase or they see it and stop chasing.
Hm, I don't have that problem often enough, sometimes early game I use it to push the wave a bit to pass along the visions faster to the enemy as well.
